newsitem.title: USA: Harris unit buys Quorum in $54 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: Harris unit buys Quorum in $54 mln deal.

text.p: Lanier Worldwide Inc, a subsidiary of Harris Corp, said Monday it acquired Quorum Group Inc for 700,000 shares of Harris common stock, valued at about $54 million.
The transaction was accounted for as a pooling of interests. Quorum is a diversified legal services company.

Quorum will operate as Quorum/Lanier, managing litigation support information services and systems, document printing and legal personnel placement. It will be part of Lanier Professional Services Inc, a Lanier unit that provides outsourcing services.

"Bringing Quorum into the Lanier Professional Services family is key to our continuing growth strategy of geographic expansion and focused service offereings," Wesley Cantrell, president and chief executive of Lanier, said in a statement.
All of Quorum's senior management will remain and all Quorum employees will be offered positions with the new company, Lanier said.
Lanier said it made six professional services acquisitions in the past two years.
